DORSET Council’s ‘spend to save’ policy on energy is already achieving around £1million a year, according to council leader Nick Ireland.

He says solar panel already fitted to public buildings reduce annual energy costs by around £750,000 with the panels also generating around £250,000 by selling excess power which is fed into the National Grid.

His comments came as the Lib Deb Cabinet endorsed further spending in the year ahead of £700,000 for additional solar panels and £1.3million in fitting LED lamps to out-dated street lights.

“We will be cutting emissions, reducing energy and building a resilient, modern public estate… this is climate leadership in practice,” said Cllr Ireland.

He also spoke about the ambition to improve transport routes for those choosing to walk, scoot or cycle instead of using cars which, he said, would also help encourage residents to adopt a healthier lifestyle.
